comments: q-integers for q=-3.Let A be the Hessenberg matrix of order n, defined by: A[1,j]=1, A[i,i]:=-3, A[i,i-1]=-1, and A[i,j]=0 otherwise. Then, for n>=1, a(n)=(-1)^n*charpoly(A,0). - _Milan Janjic_, Jan 27 2010Pisano period lengths:  1, 2, 1, 4, 4, 2, 3, 8, 1, 4, 10, 4, 6, 6, 4, 16, 16, 2, 9, 4, ... - _R. J. Mathar_, Aug 10 2012
